name: proxmoxve
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Proxmox Virtual Environment cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`proxmox` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Proxmox Virtual Environment cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-proxmoxve` repo](https://github.com/muhlba91/pulumi-proxmoxve/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-proxmox` repo](https://github.com/bpg/terraform-provider-proxmox/issues).

apiToken.description: The API token for the Proxmox VE API.

endpoint.description: The endpoint for the Proxmox VE API.

insecure.description: Whether to skip the TLS verification step.

minTls.description: The minimum required TLS version for API calls.Supported values: `1.0|1.1|1.2|1.3`. Defaults to `1.3`.

otp.description: The one-time password for the Proxmox VE API.
otp.deprecationMessage: The `otp` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `api_token` attribute instead.

password.description: The password for the Proxmox VE API.

ssh.description: The SSH configuration for the Proxmox nodes.

username.description: The username for the Proxmox VE API.

contacts.description: An array of contact email addresses.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of the account creation.

status.description: The status of the account. Can be one of `valid`, `deactivated` or `revoked`.

datastoreId.description: The identifier for the target datastore.

nodeName.description:
The name of the source node (leave blank, if
equal to the `node_name` argument).

vmId.description: The identifier for the source container.

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the console device (defaults
to `true`).

ttyCount.description: The number of available TTY (defaults to `2`).

type.description: The console mode (defaults to `tty`).

cores.description: The number of CPU cores (defaults to `1`).

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
disk in (defaults to `local`).

size.description:
The size of the root filesystem in gigabytes (defaults
to `4`). Requires `datastore_id` to be set.

fuse.description:
Whether the container supports FUSE mounts (defaults
to `false`)

keyctl.description:
Whether the container supports `keyctl()` system
call (defaults to `false`)

mounts.description: List of allowed mount types (`cifs` or `nfs`)

nesting.description:
Whether the container is nested (defaults
to `false`)

ipConfigs.description:
The IP configuration (one block per network
device).

server.description:
The DNS server. The `server` attribute is
deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use
the `servers` attribute instead.
server.deprecationMessage: The `server` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `servers` attribute instead.

gateway.description:
The IPv4 gateway (must be omitted
when `dhcp` is used as the address).

The IPv6 gateway (must be omitted
when `dhcp` is used as the address).

keys.description: The SSH keys for the root account.

password.description: The password for the root account.

dedicated.description:
The dedicated memory in megabytes (defaults
to `512`).

swap.description: The swap size in megabytes (defaults to `0`).

acl.description: Explicitly enable or disable ACL support.

backup.description:
Whether to include the mount point in backups (only
used for volume mount points, defaults to `false`).

path.description:
Path to the mount point as seen from inside the
container.

quota.description:
Enable user quotas inside the container (not supported
with ZFS subvolumes).

replicate.description: Will include this volume to a storage replica job.

shared.description:
Mark this non-volume mount point as available on all
nodes.

size.description:
Volume size (only for volume mount points).
Can be specified with a unit suffix (e.g. `10G`).

volume.description:
Volume, device or directory to mount into the
container.

bridge.description:
The name of the network bridge (defaults
to `vmbr0`).

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the network device (defaults
to `true`).

firewall.description:
Whether this interface's firewall rules should be
used (defaults to `false`).

mtu.description:
Maximum transfer unit of the interface. Cannot be
larger than the bridge's MTU.

name.description: The network interface name.

rateLimit.description: The rate limit in megabytes per second.

templateFileId.description:
The identifier for an OS template file.
The ID format is `<datastore_id>:<content_type>/<file_name>`, for example `local:iso/jammy-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz`. Can be also taken from
`proxmoxve.Download.File` resource, or from the output of `pvesm list <storage>`.

type.description: The type (defaults to `unmanaged`).

downDelay.description:
A non-negative number defining the delay in
seconds before the next container is shut down.

order.description:
A non-negative number defining the general startup
order.

upDelay.description:
A non-negative number defining the delay in
seconds before the next container is started.

lower.description: The minimum number for the next free VM ID. Must be higher or equal to 100

upper.description: The maximum number for the next free VM ID. Must be less or equal to 999999999

haFencingMode.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the HA fencing mode. Must be `always` | `never`.

haFencingTarget.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the HA fencing target.

packageUpdates.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for package updates. Must be `auto` | `always` | `never`.

packageUpdatesTarget.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the package updates target.

replication.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for replication. Must be `always` | `never`.

replicationTarget.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the replication target.

mappingId.description: The corresponding hardware mapping ID of the node check diagnostic entry.

message.description: The message of the node check diagnostic entry.

severity.description: The severity of the node check diagnostic entry.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped PCI device.

id.description: The ID of the map.

iommuGroup.description: The IOMMU group of the map. Not mandatory for the Proxmox VE API call, but causes a PCI hardware mapping to be incomplete when not set

node.description: The node name of the map.

subsystemId.description: The subsystem ID group of the map. Not mandatory for the Proxmox VE API call, but causes a PCI hardware mapping to be incomplete when not set

comment.description: The comment of the mapped USB device.

id.description: The ID of the map.

node.description: The node name of the map.

path.description: The path of the map. For hardware mappings of type USB the path is optional and indicates that the device is mapped through the device ID instead of ports.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped PCI device.

id.description: The ID attribute of the map.

iommuGroup.description: The IOMMU group attribute of the map.

node.description: The node name attribute of the map.

path.description: The path attribute of the map.

subsystemId.description: The subsystem ID attribute of the map.Not mandatory for the Proxmox VE API call, but causes a PCI hardware mapping to be incomplete when not set.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped USB device.

id.description: The ID attribute of the map.

node.description: The node name attribute of the map.

path.description: The path attribute of the map.

name.description: Network/IP specification in CIDR format.

nomatch.description:
Entries marked as `nomatch` are skipped as if those
were not added to the set.

burst.description:
Initial burst of packages which will always get
logged before the rate is applied (defaults to `5`).

enabled.description: Enable or disable the log rate limit.

rate.description:
Frequency with which the burst bucket gets refilled
(defaults to `1/second`).

dest.description:
Restrict packet destination address. This can
refer to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP
alias definition. You can also specify an address range
like `20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99`, or a list of IP addresses and
networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4
and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

dport.description:
Restrict TCP/UDP destination port. You can use
service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined
in `/etc/services`. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for
example `80:85`, and you can use comma separated list to match
several ports or ranges.

enabled.description: Enable this rule. Defaults to `true`.

iface.description:
Network interface name. You have to use network
configuration key names for VMs and containers ('net\d+'). Host
related rules can use arbitrary strings.

macro.description:
Macro name. Use predefined standard macro
from <https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#_firewall_macro_definitions>

pos.description: Position of the rule in the list.

proto.description:
Restrict packet protocol. You can use protocol
names as defined in '/etc/protocols'.

source.description:
Restrict packet source address. This can refer
to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias
definition. You can also specify an address range
like `20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99`, or a list of IP addresses and
networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4
and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

sport.description:

service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined
in `/etc/services`. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for
example `80:85`, and you can use comma separated list to match
several ports or ranges.

insecure.description:
Whether to skip the TLS verification step for
HTTPS sources (defaults to `false`).

The minimum required TLS version for HTTPS
sources. "Supported values: `1.0|1.1|1.2|1.3` (defaults to `1.3`).

path.description: A path to a local file or a URL.

resize.description: The number of bytes to resize the file to.

fileId.description: The file ID of the CD-ROM, or `cdrom|none`. Defaults to `none` to leave the CD-ROM empty. Use `cdrom` to connect to the physical drive.

id.description: The ID of the VM to clone.

retries.description: The number of retries to perform when cloning the VM (default: 3).

affinity.description: The CPU cores that are used to run the VM’s vCPU. The value is a list of CPU IDs, separated by commas. The CPU IDs are zero-based.  For example, `0,1,2,3` (which also can be shortened to `0-3`) means that the VM’s vCPUs are run on the first four CPU cores. Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

architecture.description: The CPU architecture `<aarch64 | x86_64>` (defaults to the host). Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

cores.description: The number of CPU cores per socket (defaults to `1`).

flags.description: Set of additional CPU flags. Use `+FLAG` to enable, `-FLAG` to disable a flag. Custom CPU models can specify any flag supported by QEMU/KVM, VM-specific flags must be from the following set for security reasons: `pcid`, `spec-ctrl`, `ibpb`, `ssbd`, `virt-ssbd`, `amd-ssbd`, `amd-no-ssb`, `pdpe1gb`, `md-clear`, `hv-tlbflush`, `hv-evmcs`, `aes`.

hotplugged.description: The number of hotplugged vCPUs (defaults to `0`).

limit.description: Limit of CPU usage (defaults to `0` which means no limit).

sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets (defaults to `1`).

type.description: Emulated CPU type, it's recommended to use `x86-64-v2-AES` or higher (defaults to `kvm64`). See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm*virtual*machines_settings for more information.

units.description: CPU weight for a VM. Argument is used in the kernel fair scheduler. The larger the number is, the more CPU time this VM gets. Number is relative to weights of all the other running VMs.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

clipboard.description: Enable a specific clipboard. If not set, depending on the display type the SPICE one will be added. Currently only `vnc` is available. Migration with VNC clipboard is not supported by Proxmox.

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (4-512 MB). Has no effect with serial display.

type.description: The VGA type (defaults to `std`).

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the QEMU agent (defaults
to `false`).

timeout.description:
The maximum amount of time to wait for data from
the QEMU agent to become available ( defaults to `15m`).

trim.description:
Whether to enable the FSTRIM feature in the QEMU agent
(defaults to `false`).

type.description: The QEMU agent interface type (defaults to `virtio`).

device.description:
The device (defaults to `intel-hda`).
- `AC97` - Intel 82801AA AC97 Audio.
- `ich9-intel-hda` - Intel HD Audio Controller (ich9).
- `intel-hda` - Intel HD Audio.

enabled.description:
Whether to enable the audio device (defaults
to `true`).

Whether to enable the CDROM drive (defaults
to `false`).

fileId.description:
A file ID for an ISO file (defaults to `cdrom` as
in the physical drive). Use `none` to leave the CDROM drive empty.

interface.description:
A hardware interface to connect CDROM drive to,
must be `ideN` (defaults to `ide3`). Note that `q35` machine type only
supports `ide0` and `ide2`.

datastoreId.description: The identifier for the target datastore.

nodeName.description:
The name of the source node (leave blank, if
equal to the `node_name` argument).

retries.description:
Number of retries in Proxmox for clone vm.
Sometimes Proxmox errors with timeout when creating multiple clones at
once.

vmId.description: The identifier for the source VM.

affinity.description:
The CPU cores that are used to run the VM’s vCPU. The
value is a list of CPU IDs, separated by commas. The CPU IDs are zero-based.
For example, `0,1,2,3` (which also can be shortened to `0-3`) means that the VM’s vCPUs are run on the first four
CPU cores. Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

cores.description: The number of CPU cores (defaults to `1`).

flags.description:
The CPU flags.
- `+aes`/`-aes` - Activate AES instruction set for HW acceleration.
- `+amd-no-ssb`/`-amd-no-ssb` - Notifies guest OS that host is not
vulnerable for Spectre on AMD CPUs.
- `+amd-ssbd`/`-amd-ssbd` - Improves Spectre mitigation performance with
AMD CPUs, best used with "virt-ssbd".
- `+hv-evmcs`/`-hv-evmcs` - Improve performance for nested
virtualization (only supported on Intel CPUs).
- `+hv-tlbflush`/`-hv-tlbflush` - Improve performance in overcommitted
Windows guests (may lead to guest BSOD on old CPUs).
- `+ibpb`/`-ibpb` - Allows improved Spectre mitigation on AMD CPUs.
- `+md-clear`/`-md-clear` - Required to let the guest OS know if MDS is
mitigated correctly.
- `+pcid`/`-pcid` - Meltdown fix cost reduction on Westmere, Sandy- and
Ivy Bridge Intel CPUs.
- `+pdpe1gb`/`-pdpe1gb` - Allows guest OS to use 1 GB size pages, if
host HW supports it.
- `+spec-ctrl`/`-spec-ctrl` - Allows improved Spectre mitigation with
Intel CPUs.
- `+ssbd`/`-ssbd` - Protection for "Speculative Store Bypass" for Intel
models.
- `+virt-ssbd`/`-virt-ssbd` - Basis for "Speculative Store Bypass"
protection for AMD models.

hotplugged.description:
The number of hotplugged vCPUs (defaults
to `0`).

limit.description: Limit of CPU usage, `0...128`. (defaults to `0` -- no limit).

sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets (defaults to `1`).

type.description:
The emulated CPU type, it's recommended to
use `x86-64-v2-AES` (defaults to `qemu64`).

backup.description: Whether the drive should be included when making backups (defaults to `true`).

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create
the disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

discard.description:
Whether to pass discard/trim requests to the
underlying storage. Supported values are `on`/`ignore` (defaults
to `ignore`).

fileId.description:
The file ID for a disk image. The ID format is
`<datastore_id>:<content_type>/<file_name>`, for example `local:iso/centos8.img`. Can be also taken from
`proxmoxve.Download.File` resource.

interface.description:
The disk interface for Proxmox, currently `scsi`,
`sata` and `virtio` interfaces are supported. Append the disk index at
the end, for example, `virtio0` for the first virtio disk, `virtio1` for
the second, etc.

iothread.description:
Whether to use iothreads for this disk (defaults
to `false`).

pathInDatastore.description:
The in-datastore path to the disk image.
***Experimental.***Use to attach another VM's disks,
or (as root only) host's filesystem paths (`datastore_id` empty string).
See "*Example: Attached disks*".

replicate.description: Whether the drive should be considered for replication jobs (defaults to `true`).

serial.description: The serial number of the disk, up to 20 bytes long.

size.description: The disk size in gigabytes (defaults to `8`).

ssd.description:
Whether to use an SSD emulation option for this disk (
defaults to `false`). Note that SSD emulation is not supported on VirtIO
Block drives.

iopsRead.description: The maximum read I/O in operations per second.

iopsReadBurstable.description: The maximum unthrottled read I/O pool in operations per second.

iopsWrite.description: The maximum write I/O in operations per second.

iopsWriteBurstable.description: The maximum unthrottled write I/O pool in operations per second.

read.description: The maximum read speed in megabytes per second.

readBurstable.description:
The maximum burstable read speed in
megabytes per second.

write.description: The maximum write speed in megabytes per second.

writeBurstable.description:
The maximum burstable write speed in
megabytes per second.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create
the disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

preEnrolledKeys.description:
Use am EFI vars template with
distribution-specific and Microsoft Standard keys enrolled, if used with
EFI type=`4m`. Ignored for VMs with cpu.architecture=`aarch64` (defaults
to `false`).

type.description:
Size and type of the OVMF EFI disk. `4m` is newer and
recommended, and required for Secure Boot. For backwards compatibility
use `2m`. Ignored for VMs with cpu.architecture=`aarch64` (defaults
to `2m`).

device.description:
The PCI device name for Proxmox, in form
of `hostpciX` where `X` is a sequential number from 0 to 3.

id.description:
The PCI device ID. This parameter is not compatible
with `api_token` and requires the root `username` and `password`
configured in the proxmox provider. Use either this or `mapping`.

mapping.description:
The resource mapping name of the device, for
example gpu. Use either this or `id`.

mdev.description: The mediated device ID to use.

pcie.description:
Tells Proxmox to use a PCIe or PCI port. Some
guests/device combination require PCIe rather than PCI. PCIe is only
available for q35 machine types.

romFile.description:
A path to a ROM file for the device to use. This
is a relative path under `/usr/share/kvm/`.

rombar.description:
Makes the firmware ROM visible for the VM (defaults
to `true`).

xvga.description:
Marks the PCI(e) device as the primary GPU of the VM.
With this enabled the `vga` configuration argument will be ignored.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create the
cloud-init disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

interface.description:
The hardware interface to connect the cloud-init
image to. Must be one of `ide0..3`, `sata0..5`, `scsi0..30`. Will be
detected if the setting is missing but a cloud-init image is present,
otherwise defaults to `ide2`.

ipConfigs.description:
The IP configuration (one block per network
device).

metaDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
all meta data passed to the VM via cloud-init.

networkDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
network configuration data passed to the VM via cloud-init (conflicts
with `ip_config`).

type.description: The cloud-init configuration format

upgrade.description: Whether to do an automatic package upgrade after the first boot
upgrade.deprecationMessage: The `upgrade` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.

userDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
custom user data (conflicts with `user_account`).

vendorDataFileId.description:
The identifier for a file containing
all vendor data passed to the VM via cloud-init.

server.description:
The DNS server. The `server` attribute is
deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the
`servers` attribute instead.
server.deprecationMessage: The `server` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use the `servers` attribute instead.

address.description:
The IPv4 address in CIDR notation
(e.g. 192.168.2.2/24). Alternatively, set this to `dhcp` for
autodiscovery.

gateway.description:
The IPv4 gateway (must be omitted
when `dhcp` is used as the address).

address.description:
The IPv6 address in CIDR notation
(e.g. fd1c:000:0000::0000:000:7334/64). Alternatively, set this
to `dhcp` for autodiscovery.

gateway.description:
The IPv6 gateway (must be omitted
when `dhcp` is used as the address).

dedicated.description:
The dedicated memory in megabytes (defaults
to `512`).

floating.description:
The floating memory in megabytes (defaults
to `0`).

keepHugepages.description:
Keep hugepages memory after the VM is stopped (defaults
to `false`).

Settings `hugepages` and `keep_hugepages` are only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.
And required `cpu.numa` to be enabled.

shared.description: The shared memory in megabytes (defaults to `0`).

bridge.description: The name of the network bridge (defaults to `vmbr0`).

disconnected.description: Whether to disconnect the network device from the network (defaults to `false`).

enabled.description: Whether to enable the network device (defaults to `true`).

firewall.description: Whether this interface's firewall rules should be used (defaults to `false`).

mtu.description: Force MTU, for VirtIO only. Set to 1 to use the bridge MTU. Cannot be larger than the bridge MTU.

queues.description: The number of queues for VirtIO (1..64).

rateLimit.description: The rate limit in megabytes per second.

trunks.description:
String containing a `;` separated list of VLAN trunks
("10;20;30"). Note that the VLAN-aware feature need to be enabled on the PVE
Linux Bridge to use trunks.

cpus.description: The CPU cores to assign to the NUMA node (format is `0-7;16-31`).

device.description:
The NUMA device name for Proxmox, in form
of `numaX` where `X` is a sequential number from 0 to 7.

memory.description: The memory in megabytes to assign to the NUMA node.

type.description: The type (defaults to `other`).

device.description:
The device (defaults to `socket`).
- `/dev/*` - A host serial device.

uuid.description: The UUID (defaults to randomly generated UUID).

downDelay.description:
A non-negative number defining the delay in
seconds before the next VM is shut down.

order.description:
A non-negative number defining the general startup
order.

upDelay.description:
A non-negative number defining the delay in
seconds before the next VM is started.

datastoreId.description:
The identifier for the datastore to create
the disk in (defaults to `local-lvm`).

version.description:
TPM state device version. Can be `v1.2` or `v2.0`.
(defaults to `v2.0`).

host.description: The Host USB device or port or the value `spice`. Use either this or `mapping`.

mapping.description: The cluster-wide resource mapping name of the device, for example "usbdevice". Use either this or `host`.

usb3.description:
Makes the USB device a USB3 device for the VM
(defaults to `false`).

clipboard.description: Enable VNC clipboard by setting to `vnc`. See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) section 10.2.8 for more information.

enabled.deprecationMessage: The `enabled` attribute is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Use type `none` instead.

type.description: The VGA type (defaults to `std`).

values.description: List of values to pass the filter. VM's attribute should match at least one value in the list.

nodeName.description: The node name. All cluster nodes will be queried in case this is omitted

tags.description:

the tags to be included in the result.

template.description: Is VM a template (true) or a regular VM (false)

vmId.description: The VM identifier.

agentSocket.description: The path to the SSH agent socket. Defaults to the value of the `SSH_AUTH_SOCK` environment variable.

nodes.description: Overrides for SSH connection configuration for a Proxmox VE node.

id.description: The ID of the VM to clone.

retries.description: The number of retries to perform when cloning the VM (default: 3).

affinity.description: The CPU cores that are used to run the VM’s vCPU. The value is a list of CPU IDs, separated by commas. The CPU IDs are zero-based.  For example, `0,1,2,3` (which also can be shortened to `0-3`) means that the VM’s vCPUs are run on the first four CPU cores. Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

architecture.description: The CPU architecture `<aarch64 | x86_64>` (defaults to the host). Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

cores.description: The number of CPU cores per socket (defaults to `1`).

flags.description: Set of additional CPU flags. Use `+FLAG` to enable, `-FLAG` to disable a flag. Custom CPU models can specify any flag supported by QEMU/KVM, VM-specific flags must be from the following set for security reasons: `pcid`, `spec-ctrl`, `ibpb`, `ssbd`, `virt-ssbd`, `amd-ssbd`, `amd-no-ssb`, `pdpe1gb`, `md-clear`, `hv-tlbflush`, `hv-evmcs`, `aes`.

hotplugged.description: The number of hotplugged vCPUs (defaults to `0`).

limit.description: Limit of CPU usage (defaults to `0` which means no limit).

sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets (defaults to `1`).

type.description: Emulated CPU type, it's recommended to use `x86-64-v2-AES` or higher (defaults to `kvm64`). See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm*virtual*machines_settings for more information.

units.description: CPU weight for a VM. Argument is used in the kernel fair scheduler. The larger the number is, the more CPU time this VM gets. Number is relative to weights of all the other running VMs.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

proxmoxve:CT/container:Container.description:
Manages a container.

## Import

Instances can be imported using the `node_name` and the `vm_id`, e.g.,

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import proxmoxve:CT/container:Container ubuntu_container first-node/1234
```

features.description: The container feature flags. Changing flags (except nesting) is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

hookScriptFileId.description: The identifier for a file containing a hook script (needs to be executable).

nodeName.description: The name of the node to assign the container to.

poolId.description: The identifier for a pool to assign the container to.

startOnBoot.description:
Automatically start container when the host
system boots (defaults to `true`).

started.description: Whether to start the container (defaults to `true`).

startup.description: Defines startup and shutdown behavior of the container.

tags.description:
A list of tags the container tags. This is only meta
information (defaults to `[]`). Note: Proxmox always sorts the container tags.
If the list in template is not sorted, then Proxmox will always report a
difference on the resource. You may use the `ignore_changes` lifecycle
meta-argument to ignore changes to this attribute.

template.description: Whether to create a template (defaults to `false`).

timeoutClone.description: Timeout for cloning a container in seconds (defaults to 1800).

timeoutCreate.description: Timeout for creating a container in seconds (defaults to 1800).

timeoutDelete.description: Timeout for deleting a container in seconds (defaults to 60).

the host (defaults to `false`).

contentType.description: The file content type. Must be `iso` for VM images or `vztmpl` for LXC images.

datastoreId.description: The identifier for the target datastore.

decompressionAlgorithm.description: Decompress the downloaded file using the specified compression algorithm. Must be one of `gz` | `lzo` | `zst`.

fileName.description: The file name. If not provided, it is calculated using `url`. PVE will raise 'wrong file extension' error for some popular extensions file `.raw` or `.qcow2`. Workaround is to use e.g. `.img` instead.

overwrite.description: If `true` and size of uploaded file is different, than size from `url` Content-Length header, file will be downloaded again. If `false`, there will be no checks.

overwriteUnmanaged.description: If `true` and a file with the same name already exists in the datastore, it will be deleted and the new file will be downloaded. If `false` and the file already exists, an error will be returned.

uploadTimeout.description: The file download timeout seconds. Default is 600 (10min).

url.description: The URL to download the file from. Format `https?://.*`.

verify.description: By default `true`. If `false`, no SSL/TLS certificates will be verified.

comment.description: The comment associated with this group

group.description: The identifier of the High Availability group to manage.

noFailback.description: A flag that indicates that failing back to a higher priority node is disabled for this HA group. Defaults to `false`.

nodes.description: The member nodes for this group. They are provided as a map, where the keys are the node names and the values represent their priority: integers for known priorities or `null` for unset priorities.

restricted.description: A flag that indicates that other nodes may not be used to run resources associated to this HA group. Defaults to `false`.

proxmoxve:VM/virtualMachine2:VirtualMach.description:
!> **DO NOT USE** This is an experimental implementation of a Proxmox VM resource using Plugin Framework.

It is a Proof of Concept, highly experimental and **will** change in future. It does not support all features of the Proxmox API for VMs and **MUST NOT** be used in production. > Many attributes are marked as **optional** _and_ **computed** in the schema, hence you may seem added to the plan with "(known after apply)" status, even if they are not set in the configuration. This is done to support the `clone` operation, when a VM is created from an existing VM or template, and the source attributes are copied to the clone.

Computed attributes allow the provider to set those attributes without user input. The attributes are also marked as optional to allow the practitioner to set (or overwrite) them if needed.

cdrom.description: The CD-ROM configuration. The key is the interface of the CD-ROM, could be one of `ideN`, `sataN`, `scsiN`, where N is the index of the interface. Note that `q35` machine type only supports `ide0` and `ide2` of IDE interfaces.

name.description: The name of the VM. Doesn't have to be unique.

nodeName.description: The name of the node where the VM is provisioned.

stopOnDestroy.description: Set to true to stop (rather than shutdown) the VM on destroy (defaults to `false`).

tags.description: The tags assigned to the VM.

template.description: Set to true to create a VM template.

vga.description: Configure the VGA Hardware. If you want to use high resolution modes (>= 1280x1024x16) you may need to increase the vga memory option. Since QEMU 2.9 the default VGA display type is `std` for all OS types besides some Windows versions (XP and older) which use `cirrus`. The `qxl` option enables the SPICE display server. For win* OS you can select how many independent displays you want, Linux guests can add displays themself. You can also run without any graphic card, using a serial device as terminal. See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) section 10.2.8 for more information and available configuration parameters.

cdrom.description: The CD-ROM configuration. The key is the interface of the CD-ROM, could be one of `ideN`, `sataN`, `scsiN`, where N is the index of the interface. Note that `q35` machine type only supports `ide0` and `ide2` of IDE interfaces.

name.description: The name of the VM. Doesn't have to be unique.

For win* OS you can select how many independent displays you want, Linux guests can add displays themself. You can also run without any graphic card, using a serial device as terminal. See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) section 10.2.8 for more information and available configuration parameters.

proxmoxve:VM/virtualMachine:VirtualMachi.description:
Manages a virtual machine.

> This resource uses SSH access to the node. You might need to configure the `ssh` option in the `provider` section.

## Import

Instances can be imported using the `node_name` and the `vm_id`, e.g.,

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import proxmoxve:VM/virtualMachine:VirtualMachine ubuntu_vm first-node/4321
```

they appear in the list (defaults to `[]`).

resource. You may use the `ignore_changes` lifecycle meta-argument to ignore

proxmoxve:index/certifi:Certifi.description:
Manages the custom SSL/TLS certificate for a specific node.

## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```yaml
resources:
  example:
    type: proxmoxve:Certifi
    properties:
      certificate: ${proxmoxVirtualEnvironmentCertificateSelfSignedCert.certPem}
      nodeName: first-node
      privateKey: ${proxmoxVirtualEnvironmentCertificatePrivateKey.privateKeyPem}
  proxmoxVirtualEnvironmentCertificatePrivateKey:
    type: tls:PrivateKey
    properties:
      algorithm: RSA
      rsaBits: 2048
  proxmoxVirtualEnvironmentCertificateSelfSignedCert:
    type: tls:SelfSignedCert
    properties:
      keyAlgorithm: ${proxmoxVirtualEnvironmentCertificatePrivateKey.algorithm}
      privateKeyPem: ${proxmoxVirtualEnvironmentCertificatePrivateKey.privateKeyPem}
      subject:
        commonName: example.com
        organization: Terraform Provider for Proxmox
      validityPeriodHours: 8760
      allowedUses:
        - key_encipherment
        - digital_signature
        - server_auth
```
<!--End PulumiCodeChooser -->

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite an existing certificate
Whether to overwrite an existing certificate

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Certifi resources.

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite an existing certificate

proxmoxve:index/dNS:DNS.description:
Manages the DNS configuration for a specific node.

## Import

Instances can be imported using the `node_name`, e.g.,

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import proxmoxve:index/dNS:DNS first_node first-node
```

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DNS resources.

proxmoxve:index/hosts:Hosts.description:
Manages the host entries on a specific node.

## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```yaml
resources:
  firstNodeHostEntries:
    type: proxmoxve:Hosts
    properties:
      entries:
        - address: 127.0.0.1
          hostnames:
            - localhost
            - localhost.localdomain
      nodeName: first-node
```
<!--End PulumiCodeChooser -->

## Important Notes

Be careful not to use this resource multiple times for the same node.

## Import

Instances can be imported using the `node_name`, e.g.,

bash

```sh
$ pulumi import proxmoxve:index/hosts:Hosts first_node_host_entries first-node
```

proxmoxve:index/vm2:Vm2.description:
!> **DO NOT USE** This is an experimental implementation of a Proxmox VM resource using Plugin Framework.

It is a Proof of Concept, highly experimental and **will** change in future. It does not support all features of the Proxmox API for VMs and **MUST NOT** be used in production. > Many attributes are marked as **optional** _and_ **computed** in the schema, hence you may seem added to the plan with "(known after apply)" status, even if they are not set in the configuration. This is done to support the `clone` operation, when a VM is created from an existing VM or template, and the source attributes are copied to the clone.

Computed attributes allow the provider to set those attributes without user input. The attributes are also marked as optional to allow the practitioner to set (or overwrite) them if needed.

cdrom.description: The CD-ROM configuration. The key is the interface of the CD-ROM, could be one of `ideN`, `sataN`, `scsiN`, where N is the index of the interface. Note that `q35` machine type only supports `ide0` and `ide2` of IDE interfaces.

name.description: The name of the VM. Doesn't have to be unique.

nodeName.description: The name of the node where the VM is provisioned.

stopOnDestroy.description: Set to true to stop (rather than shutdown) the VM on destroy (defaults to `false`).

tags.description: The tags assigned to the VM.

template.description: Set to true to create a VM template.

vga.description: Configure the VGA Hardware. If you want to use high resolution modes (>= 1280x1024x16) you may need to increase the vga memory option. Since QEMU 2.9 the default VGA display type is `std` for all OS types besides some Windows versions (XP and older) which use `cirrus`. The `qxl` option enables the SPICE display server. For win* OS you can select how many independent displays you want, Linux guests can add displays themself. You can also run without any graphic card, using a serial device as terminal. See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) section 10.2.8 for more information and available configuration parameters.
